Description: Fragment of rim and floor of East Greek pottery plate, mended from two fragments; brown-buff clay with calcareous inclusions; on top of rim broken cable band beteeen bands; red band and glazed band at edge of floor; lotus flower with tendrils in exergue below string line of metopal design, blobs and dots between pairs of lines. Outside of rim glazed; three bands on underside.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1167)
